business.headline: Will India be hit with a 500% tariff? Here's what we knowIndia remains one of the few countries still in talks with the US at a time when the Trump administration is preparing to enforce steep new tariffs on imports from several nations starting August 1.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

Explained: Why HUL shares rose 4% todayHUL shares were up 3.8%, trading at Rs 2,500 as of 9;25 am, compared to Thursday's closing price of Rs 2,409.05. The stock ended Thursday's session nearly 1% lower but has gained 3.58% in the past five days.
Sensex opens 280 points lower, Nifty below 25,300; HUL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.37 points to 82,939.91, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 64.95 points to 25,290.30 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Weak TCS Q1 results to hamper Sensex, Nifty?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,295 as of 8:30 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 could open below Thursday's closing mark of 25,355.25.
Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

IMF praises UPI, says it makes India global leader in fast paymentUnified Payments Interface is an instant and real-time payment system developed by NPCI to facilitate inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

71% Indians fear AI scams during Prime Day: ReportPrime Day scams India, AI shopping scams 2025, McAfee Prime Day scam report, Fake Amazon websites India, online shopping scam awareness, AI scam protection tips, Prime Day fake deals warning, Indians fear online scams, cyber fraud Prime Day India, deepfake scams online shopping

Travel Food Services IPO to close soon: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe bidding for the IPO began on July 7 and is set to close soon. Travel Food Services has set the price band for the issue between Rs 1,045 and Rs 1,100 per share.

ITR filing: Who qualifies for zero income tax?In her 2025 Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared big news. Under the new regime, if you earn up to Rs 12 lakh, you will not have to pay any income tax. Salaried taxpayers get an extra benefit too.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Will top IT companies gain momentum in Q1FY26?Equirus Securities, in its earnings preview, signals a subdued performance for the sector, where even the heavyweights are struggling to regain momentum.

Mutual fund inflows rise 24% in June to Rs 23,587 crore: AMFI dataAmong the 11 equity mutual fund categories, all except equity-linked savings schemes (ELSS) recorded positive inflows. Flexi cap funds emerged as the most preferred option for investors, bringing in Rs 5,733 crore in June.

entertainment.headline: Censor Board faces flak for cuts in Superman and F1, fans say grow upThe Censor Board has faced widespread criticism for cutting a romantic scene from the Hollywood film 'Superman', sparking debates on its inconsistent censorship standards compared to Bollywood movies. This controversy highlighted ongoing tensions over cultural sensitivity and film certification practices in India.

Are Ashish Chanchlani and Elli AvrRam dating? Fans think so after latest postAshish Chanchlani and Elli AvRam shared a cryptic Instagram post on Saturday, fuelling dating rumours amongst fans. The caption "Finally," added fuel to the already surfacing rumours.

Mini Mathur says many use what Shefali Jariwala did, stresses doctor's adviceFollowing the death of Shefali Jariwala, Mini Mathur emphasised the urgent need for medical supervision and open dialogue to ensure health and safety in beauty procedures.

Panchayat's Sunita Rajwar says people are abusing her over a scene in Season 4Actor Sunita Rajwar responded to backlash from a scene in Panchayat Season 4 in a recent interview. The scene involves Rajwar's character, Kranti Devi, making objectionable remarks towards a pregnant character.

Our new travel buddy: Patralekhaa wants to go bungee jumping with Rajkummar, babyActor Patralekhaa expressed her desire to visit New Zealand with her husband, actor Rajkummar Rao, and their future baby - and even try bungee jumping together. In a recent interview, she also spoke about taking a break from work to focus on her pregnancy.

Exclusive: Salman Khan pushed me to explore commercial roles, says Chitrangada SinghChitrangda Singh joined Salman Khan's upcoming film, 'Galwan', marking her commercial film debut with him. She told India Today he encouraged her to explore mainstream cinema.

Varun Dhawan gifts his sunglasses to young fan at airport, wins hearts. WatchIn a heartwarming gesture, actor Varun Dhawan gifted his sunglasses to a young fan at Mumbai airport on Friday. The actor recently wrapped up the Pune schedule of his upcoming film 'Border 2'.

Maalik vs Aankhon… box office Day 1: Rajkummar's film outshines Shanaya's debutRajkummar Rao's gangster drama 'Maalik' opened with a modest Rs 3.35 crore on Day 1 amidst tough competition. Meanwhile, Shanaya Kapoor's debut 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan' witnessed a slow start.

Anupam Kher hosts special screening of Tanvi The Great for President MurmuThe President of India, Droupadi Murmu, watched the eagerly awaited film 'Tanvi The Great' at a special screening in Rashtrapati Bhavan. Featuring a stellar cast, it releases on July 18.

What is the formula for bringing middle-class audience back to theatres?The Indian middle-class audience has long been the driving force behind theatrical success, but the shifting focus towards niche, urban content has left them disconnected. To bring them back to cinemas, filmmakers must offer relatable stories, strong characters, and value-for-money entertainment that reflects their everyday lives.

Janhvi Kapoor-Shikhar Pahariya serve style at Wimbledon 2025Janhvi Kapoor attended the Wimbledon 2025 semi-final in London with her boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya, drawing attention for their stylish presence. Several videos and images of the duo have surfaced online.

Anurag Kashyap says Siddhant Chaturvedi's comment changed Ananya PandayAnurag Kashyap praised Ananya Panday's growth as an actor, highlighting her maturity and risk-taking in career choices despite being a 'nepo baby'.

Shiva Rajkumar: Beyond bloodline, a powerhouse who redefined Kannada cinemaAt 63, with almost four decades of stardom behind him and no signs of slowing down, Kannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar stands as the powerhouse of the Kannada film industry. But what about him attracts such devotion and respect?

Coco Jones and Donovan Mitchell announce engagement after secret romance Grammy winner Coco Jones and NBA star Donovan Mitchell announced their engagement after two years of dating, sharing a romantic video and photo while opening up about their formerly private relationship.

Paul McCartney announces 2025 'Got Back' tour with 19 North American datesPaul McCartney's 2025 Got Back Tour spans 19 North American cities, starting September 29. Presale access begins July 15. Major stops include Las Vegas, Nashville, Montreal, and Chicago.

Julian McMahon's cause of death confirmed as metastatic cancerJulian McMahon, known for Nip/Tuck and Charmed, died at 56 from metastatic cancer. Co-stars Alyssa Milano and Ioan Gruffudd paid tribute to his talent, warmth, and enduring presence.
Top films and shows to watch on JioHotstar this weekendFrom documentaries and suspense thrillers to reality series, here's what you can watch on JioHotstar this weekend.

Director James Gunn calls Govinda's Superman meme the bestAhead of 'Superman's India release, James Gunn shared a special message for Indian fans and laughed over Govinda's viral Superman meme from 'Dariya Dil', calling it "the best." The video, also featuring stars David Corenswet and Rachel Brosnahan, invited Indian audiences to catch the film in theatres.

Top films and shows to watch on Prime Video this weekendPrime Video's new weekend lineup offers a diverse mix of genres, from gripping documentaries and thrilling suspense to action-packed dramas and quirky horror comedies. Indian viewers can enjoy top picks like 'Zero Se Restart,' 'Ballard,' and 'Karate Kid: Legends' for an entertaining and relaxed weekend.

general news.headline: Don't jump to conclusions based on pilots' conversation: Centre on crash reportThe initial probe has revealed that three seconds after take-off from Ahmedabad, fuel supply to both engines of the Air India Boeing 787 got cut off.

Seconds before Mayday, Air India fuel switches turned back from 'cutoff' to 'run'While the first engine's core deceleration stopped, reversed, and began to recover, the second engine could not arrest its deceleration, according to the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's report released today, a month after the June 12 crash.

You spent Rs 2.5 crore on me, have faith: Radhika Yadav tried to counsel fatherTennis player Radhika Yadav's father, Deepak, spent over Rs 2.5 crore on her tennis training. However, an injury suffered two years ago kept Radhika away from pursuing a career in tennis.

3rd Test Day 3 Live: , Pant and KL Rahul battle to regain controlIND vs ENG, 3rd Test Day 3 Live Score: After a mixed day with the ball, India's batting got off to a shaky start as skipper Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Karun Nair fell in quick succession. With England bowlers sensing an opening, the onus is now on KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant to steady the ship and swing the momentum back in India's favour.

Air India crash: The many scenarios that fuel cut-off throws upThe AAIB's July 11, 2025, report on the June 12 Air India Boeing 787-8 crash in Ahmedabad, killing 260, cites fuel control switches moving to 'Cutoff' post-takeoff. Pilot confusion, mechanical issues, or sabotage are under investigation, with a final report due by June 2026.

Screening doesn't end at approval: US to deport visa holders who break rulesThe US embassy in India has issued a strict warning to visa holders about compliance with American laws. Failure to follow rules may lead to visa revocation and deportation as the Trump administration tightens immigration policies.
Rain likely in Delhi-NCR within next 2 hoursSeveral parts in Delhi-NCR are expected to experience light to moderate rainfall within next 2 hours.

Sinner rules out elbow injury concerns, ready for Wimbledon final vs AlcarazJannik Sinner has ruled out injury concerns with regards to his elbow and is raring to go against Carlos Alcaraz in the Wimbledon 2025 final for the men's singles division.

Hunted down, raped by sex cult in the woods: Woman's lawsuit against cop fatherCourtney Tamagny has filed a lawsuit accusing her father, the Leornia Police Chief, of ritualistic abuse spanning over a decade. She alleged that he is part of a satanic cult that held horrific ceremonies in the woods near their home.

'I didn't cut off fuel': Cockpit exchange of Air India pilots before crashAs per the report, one of the pilots aboard the ill-fated Air India Boeing 787 that crashed in Ahmedabad on June 12 asked, "Why did you cutoff the fuel?" The other pilot responded, "I did not do so."

DK Shivakumar's cryptic 'fighting for chair' remark amid tussle with SiddaramaiahDeputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar's comments about holding on to chairs drew laughter from the audience. However, the veiled remark—coming amid an ongoing power tussle with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah—has sparked fresh speculation over the future of Karnataka's leadership.

7 years ago, US body flagged potential fuel control switch issue on 737 jetsAir India crash probe: Since the bulletin by the FAA was advisory and not mandatory, Air India did not perform the recommended inspections.

What is the formula for bringing middle-class audience back to theatres?The Indian middle-class audience has long been the driving force behind theatrical success, but the shifting focus towards niche, urban content has left them disconnected. To bring them back to cinemas, filmmakers must offer relatable stories, strong characters, and value-for-money entertainment that reflects their everyday lives.

Wimbledon: Once time-proof, Novak Djokovic finally looked mortalWimbledon 2025: For nearly two decades, Novak Djokovic defied time with grit and brilliance. But on Centre Court, against a rising Jannik Sinner, he looked powerless to stop the clock. The warrior who once bent eras to his will finally appeared mortal.

This controversy highlighted ongoing tensions over cultural sensitivity and film certification practices in India.

Floating hotels, silk trails and jungle safaris: India's cruise storyCruises - both domestic and international - are emerging as the next big travel trend in India. A new travel trend report by SOTC and Thomas Cook notes that Indians are increasingly opting for new and unique travel formats, with cruises topping the list.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Caught on CCTV: Domestic help assaults pet dog, slams it on floor in JaipurThe CCTV footage shows the domestic help brutally assaulting the dog while alone at the residence. She is also seen beating the dog as it tries to flee.

Indian kids under 5 spending double the safe screen time, finds studyNew research shows children under five in India spend 2.2 hours daily on screens -- twice the safe limit advised by experts. Even infants are spending 1.2 hours daily glued to screens when the recommended time for them is zero.
The cultural spectacle: Ambani wedding as a celebration of Indian heritageA grand showcase of India's cultural soul.

Decoding the fuel switches behind the deadly Air India crashUnderstanding how these switches function and their critical role in flight operations is essential for grasping the sequence of events that led to the disaster.

AI will soon crack any UG science problem: Mathematician Manjul Bhargava at IIScArtificial Intelligence is improving fast and may soon solve any undergraduate science or math problem, said noted mathematician Manjul Bhargava at the IISc convocation in Bengaluru.

Why Bengaluru's chicken-rice for stray dogs is a bone of contentionBengaluru's civic body, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), plans to serve chicken-rice to 5,000 street dogs every day at an annual cost of Rs 2.88 crore. The plan is aimed at curbing the aggression of dogs. Supporters call it humane, while critics slam it as a misuse of taxpayer money. Here's the debate.

In a recent interview, she also spoke about taking a break from work to focus on her pregnancy.

sports.headline: Sinner rules out elbow injury concerns, ready for Wimbledon final vs AlcarazJannik Sinner has ruled out injury concerns with regards to his elbow and is raring to go against Carlos Alcaraz in the Wimbledon 2025 final for the men's singles division.

Siraj on his tribute to Jota: Life is unpredictable, tomorrow not guaranteedMohammed Siraj reveals why he decided to make a tribute to Diogo Jota, the Portuguese footballer who died in a car crash recently. The fast-bowler mentions that he is a big fan of Ronaldo and the Portugal national team and wanted to make a heartfelt tribute.

3rd Test Day 3 Live: , Pant and KL Rahul battle to regain controlIND vs ENG, 3rd Test Day 3 Live Score: After a mixed day with the ball, India's batting got off to a shaky start as skipper Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Karun Nair fell in quick succession. With England bowlers sensing an opening, the onus is now on KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant to steady the ship and swing the momentum back in India's favour.

Gill hit 430 runs, 2 bowlers got six wickets: Dukes ball CEO slams criticsDukes ball manufacturer Dilip Jajodia slammed critics who were vocal about the deteriorating quality of the red ball. The Indian camp was unhappy with the ball due to the rate of wearing out, resulting in two ball changes in a span of 10 overs.

Alcaraz not expecting mental edge over Sinner in Wimbledon final: He'll be betterJust weeks after their epic French Open final, Carlos Alcaraz refuses to claim any mental edge over Jannik Sinner ahead of the Wimbledon 2025 title clash, expecting a stronger, sharper version of the Italian.

Football federation confirms ISL on hold, awaits top court order to decide fateThe AIFF has officially paused the Indian Super League for 2025–26, citing ongoing Supreme Court proceedings. While fans await clarity, efforts are ongoing behind the scenes to bring the league back stronger.

Return to old Dukes, end saliva ban: Kumble on ball-controversy at Lord'sENG vs IND: Former India cricketer Anil Kumble has suggested that the current Duke's ball, which is under severe scrutiny, should be put aside and go back to the older ones that lasted much longer. This comes after the disappointment with the current ball used for the Lord's Test.

Joe Root on India's ball-change outburst: Can't keep slowing the game downENG vs IND: Joe Root acknowledged the challenges with the softening Dukes ball but urged players to adapt instead of stalling play — subtly referring to India's on-field disagreement with umpires over a ball change during the Lord's Test.

Jasprit Bumrah relishing Lord's honours board feat: A story for my sonENG vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah's 5/74 at Lord's earned him a spot on the Honours Board — a proud milestone he'll one day share as a story with his son, etched forever at the Home of Cricket.

Joe Burns journey: From MS Dhoni's farewell to leading Italy to T20 World CupJoe Burns led Italy to their maiden appearance in the 2026 T20 World Cup, set to be held in India and Sri Lanka. Italy secured their spot in the tournament after winning their final qualifying match against the Netherlands on Friday.

Italy secured their spot in the tournament after winning their final qualifying match against the Netherlands on Friday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
